title: 3-part Inference Scoring
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response

The primary goal of this question is to assess a student’s ability to perform an appropriate significance test to address a particular question. More specific goals are to assess students’ ability to state appropriate hypotheses; identify the name of an appropriate statistical test and check appropriate conditions for performing the named test; calculate a correct test statistic and p MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGWbaaaa@39F3@ -value; and draw a correct conclusion, with justification, in the context of the study.

Scoring

Scoring steps 1, 2, and 3 are each scored as essentially correct (E), partially correct (P), or incorrect (I).
descriptions:
All three scoring parts incorrect

OR

One scoring part partially correct and two scoring parts incorrect

One scoring part essentially correct and two scoring parts incorrect

OR

Two scoring parts partially correct and one scoring part incorrect

Two scoring parts essentially correct and one scoring part incorrect

OR

One scoring part essentially correct and two scoring parts partially correct

OR

One scoring part essentially correct, one scoring part partially correct, and one scoring part incorrect

OR

All three scoring parts partially correct
Two scoring parts essentially correct and one scoring part partially correct
